name: Briciola
address: 370 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, USA

reviews.text: Very intimate and cozy dining experience with incredible food and even better service. Sara went above and beyond for our 10yr anniversary and made the night even more special. Will 100% be coming back!
We ate a very tender lamb dish accompanied by Parmesan risotto, and some wonderful truffle gnocchi.  We had a good wine and finished with a delicious tiramisu. The place is highly recommended.
Very quaint! Nice lunch special.

Wir hatten einen wunderbaren Abend in diesem kleinen SchmuckstÃ¼ck! Das Restaurant ist unglaublich gemÃ¼tlich und der franzÃ¶sische Gastgeber hat uns sehr aufmerksam und freundlich empfangen und bewirtet. Das Essen war sehr gut - vor allem der Caesar Salat und das hausgemachte Tiramisu waren kÃ¶stlich, ebenso der Wein und der Digestiv - und alles wirklich sehr bezahlbar. Ein echter Geheimtipp und unbedingt empfehlenswert!

DAMN  Alex! Itâ€™s rare to go to a place in Times Square that feels intimate but this place is it! The food, the drinks, the people, the atmosphere, grab a seat at the bar and wait for Alex to make your night ;)

Yesterday we came as a party of 5 sitting inside and everyone and everything was fantastic! Food was on point, desserts and wine also amazing. We had all the recommendations given to us and special desserts and I cannot choose which dish I liked the most. Alissa our server was the cherry on top, she checked on us at the right times and made us feel like home. Thank you and we will definitely be coming back!!
Sara was the best server ever! Phenomenal food, phenol service. Came here to celebrate a friendâ€™s engagement and everything was incredible. Highly recommend coming here!!!
mauvais rank
Expensive..but very good.
La chica. Que nos atendio tiene muy buena vibra y es muy muy simpatica, hace la experiencia muy agradable. La comida de exelente porcion y deliciosa, 100% satisfechos, lugar bastante agradable!!
Very good mixture of Italian classics in a â€œfast foodâ€ fashion. Short waiting time, very cool atmosphere
tasty linguini clam and arugula salad and red wine and service overall cute place and more - will return  reasonable prices for all dishes

Great service, not your typical Italian in NY so it's definitely worth a visit if you're after something a little different.

Mushroom bruschetta is a nice way to start the meal. Both pastas we ordered were good (Mac and cheese with gnocchi and salissicia).

Definitely worth another visit!

Thanks again to social media for finding us this spot!

ATMOSPHERE:
The place is super tiny. There's bar seating along with a sliver of a counter for drinks only. There's a separated room which has more tables but not by much. The place is decorated very intimately with brick floors and walls.

MENU:
Traditional Italian.

FOOD:
Mista e Pere Salad
AKA salad with thinly sliced pears. Nice & refreshing choice.

Burrata Special
Fresh prosciutto and a ball of fresh mozzarella on top and drizzled with balsamic vinegar. Simply delish.

Fettuccine Ai Funghi
Homemade pasta in a light cream sauce and topped with fresh parsley. I'm not a fan of homemade pasta as I've never had it cooked perfect. This time around the pasta was a little underdone and had a dry, coarse texture. The taste was good and the portion pretty small. All the pastas were listed at $12.50. I'd rather pay more to receive more.

SERVICE:
The 3-in-one male bartender/waiter/bus boy was friendly & professional. He could've been the owner or manager of the place from what I got.

OVERALL:
Good price, small portioned entrees, and open late.

El mejor lugar para comer en Hell's Kitchen, te reciben con amabilidad, te atienden con cariÃ±o y los platillos son maravillosos.

Cuando regreso a NYC es una parada obligada.

We came here after seeing a play nearby, and they had comfortable outdoor seating available straight away. Staff were lovely and very attentive, and we really enjoyed the meat & cheese board, spaghetti and meatballs, and the Caprese salad. The tiramisu was delicious and chocolatey. They have a nice wine selection available.

SCRUMPTIOUS food! Itâ€™s one of those places that not only everything on the menu is mind blowing-ly delicious but itâ€™s also one of those places that the service is the main reason to come back! For dessert, get the chocolate soufflÃ© (seriously, might sound basic and not authentic but they have, hands down, the best lava cake in entire nyc). The only (big) issue for me is the shared seating, Iâ€™m not the type that feels comfortable rubbing elbows with strangers and have meals while the couple 5 inches from me talking about their relationship. Gladly was still summer and there were tables outside.
great atmosphere, incredible food and very attentive staff - couldnâ€™t have loved it more!
On one hand, food very good and nice atmosphere. Impressive how it is all managed from one tiny kitchen.â€¦
Absolutely fantastic service and the food was great. I got the mushroom linguini and a grilled Octopus salad and both were phenomenal.

Lovely restaurant in Hells Kitchen (HK)!
Small and cozy setting inside, if youâ€™ll prefer space opt for outside seating.
The serves were so welcoming and attentive. Food is delicious.  Worth the visit.

Found this cute little spot on W 51st walking distance from the Winter Garden Broadway Theater. Stopping in for a small plates experience before our show. Service was great, food excellent, and our server was very attentive and pleasant. Definitely recommend the Bristecca over arugula too.
Cute little spot, food was amazing.The shrimp and the lobster ravioli were  delicious! Iâ€™ll come back for sure next time Iâ€™m in NYC.

So the food was very tasty.. but for the small quantities it was quite expensive for us.  We were shocked at the portion size for the cost.  If we did not get bread we would have been starving and gone to bed hungry.
Everything was fresh, every dish served hot, quick service. Will be back!

Insgesamt relativ teuer fÃ¼r ein durchschnittliches Essen.

Der "Ceasar Salad" fÃ¼r 15 $ netto war geradezu frech. 1/5 eine Eisbergsalats mit einem faden Dressing und 7 Croutons vermengt, 2 Anchovisfilets und ein paar Raspel geschmacklosen weichen HartkÃ¤se.

Der Wein ist maÃŸlos Ã¼berteuert.

Das Ambiente ist nett und man kann drauÃŸen sitzen und essen, man wird aber permanent vom Personal und Besitzter beobachtet und hat stÃ¤ndig das GefÃ¼hl, nicht genug und nicht schnell genug zu konsumieren.

Herzliche und freundliche Bewirtung geht anders. Ein LÃ¤cheln suchten wir die ganze Zeit vergebens.

Inkl. 20% Trinkgeld (war nicht meine Entscheidung) haben wir fÃ¼r eine Flasche eines einfachen Nero D'Avola, 1 Ceasar Salad, 1 Pasta mit Shrimps, Muscheln und Sepia in "SafransoÃŸe" ğŸ§ğŸ¤”, 1x Lasagne und 1x gebr. Fischfilet mit Spinat sowie 2 GlÃ¤ser Eis mit Cola und 2 Flaschen Wasser 256,- $ ausgegeben.

Vor 2 Tagen in Paris hÃ¤tten wir dafÃ¼r ein Essensfeuerwerk im Sternebereich bekommen.

Man kann nicht grundsÃ¤tzlich abraten, aber eine Empfehlung wird es definitiv nicht. Es gibt sicherlich genug Alternatuven in der Umgebung.

Die Fotos zeigen den direkten Vergleich aus Paris (Alcoryllis Ristorante Italiano) und dem Briciola (die gelbe Pasta). Da liegen Welten dazwischen.
We came here late at night for a mini date. The pasta was delicious, thanks for the great service!!!

Great food.

Excellent service. Tight spot but worth a visit.

En una semana hemos venido dos veces. Nos ha encantado. El servicio muy amable, y la comida estupenda. El lugar merece la pena porque es diferente.  Hemos procurado probar los dos dÃ­as cosas diferentes, y estaba todo estupendo. Ha merecido mucho la pena.

Came here twice. Tried multiple things of the menu, everything was 12/10. The grilled octopus warm salad is â€œto die forâ€. Rose wine was amazing, cocktails are amazingâ€¦ Service? 15/10. Lu deserves everything she can get. No fakeness, genuine good personality with genuine good vibes.
If there is only one place in Hells Kitchen that I would go to every single day, it would be Briciola.

I found this lovely place soon after I moved to Manhattan and it is one of our favorite go to restaurants.  The food is excellent (do not miss the lamb shank), the service is extraordinary and the prices are very reasonable.  I feel lucky to live in the neighborhood but we always meet people who have travelled distances (some great distances) to eat here and everyone always leaves happy.  Thanks Alex and Lu!
I donâ€™t have many photos because I mostly get take out. I eat here 2-4 times a week. I love their pastas, particularly the bolognese and orchetti, beet salad and lamb chops.
Wonderful food and fantastic service! Every time I visit, Iâ€™m welcomed with genuine hospitality that makes the experience feel special. Highly recommend this restaurant.
Cute spot. Tasty food. Excellent service.

Un lugar pequeÃ±o donde la host es insolente y hostigadora sin tomar en cuenta el bienestar del cliente. Entre a cenar y solo comÃ­ la entrada por que ella estabahostigandome constantemente para pedir y pagar. Es una insolente. El cliente no tiene que recibir atropellos de pÃ¡rate de una Host. Horrible el trato. No recomendado.

i came here with my friend to celebrate her birthday, and we had such a good time! we sat at the beautiful bar and split mussels for an appetizer that were absolutely delicious. i had pesto pasta for my dinner, and she had bolognese that she adored. the servers were incredibly friendly and did a marvelous job. i asked our waitress at the end of our dinner if she could put a birthday candle into our dessert to surprise my friend, and they did not disappoint. i highly recommend celebrating birthdays here. the "candle" was more like a firework, and they turned the lights off in the restaurant as they delivered dessert and sang happy birthday. we both had a great time, and will certainly be back!!!!!
Super good food great service one long table is actually kind of cool; forces you to socialize
The food was ok (nothing remarkable), but the servers were quite rude. They kept looking over to see if weâ€™re done. They didnâ€™t bring us bread and did for other guests. I would not visit again.

Right portion size for ladies!  I always feel pressured in some restaurants to order $45 lamb chops as main course as I always have trouble to finish them but I don't want to cost food waste.  This $19 dish is perfect size with some appetizers.
As a wine lover, the wine list is also pretty legit and extremely reasonable priced ( especially considering the location)

Lastly. Amazing service!

We were dismayed that we were walked over the road to a restaurant with a different name where the service was lackluster.

The gnocchi with truffles was underwhelming. The rest of the food was middle of the road.

If you are looking for reasonably priced food that is okay but nothing to write home about, this may be your place.
Catalina was awesome! Best lamb shank ever!
Cozy delicious spot. Love to keep coming back.
Sarah was the best!!! The wine and food was amazing!!

We made a reservation for 6 pm for a farewell dinner (which was noted in the reservation). We show up for our reservation, not only did they not have space they kept saying it will be available momentarily even though i could see everyoneâ€¦

Cozy little place on the corner, the food was delicious and everything was prepered good, service was friendly as well and we enjoy it in general. Both lamb shank and lamb pasta were very nice.
The only minus is that Italian restaurant in New York doesnâ€™t have espresso.

luckily my friend and I were there on an evening that was not crowded. We had a wonderful dinner. She had a lamb pasta dish and since I don't eat meat had the pasta with mushrooms (generous amount, fresh and flavorful!). I usually don't like most restaurants that overspice, oversalt and overdo any flavors that should be subtle. And Briciola hit the right note of invitingly flavorful without drowning the natural taste of ingredients! It is small and cozy, but if you get there at the right time of day early in the week I think you will reap the best out of this restaurant. Since it is on a side street and not on the avenue it is also not as "high octane" energy as other places are in that area.
Small place. Most seating that is not at the bar is outside.
Actually the best Italian, and tiramisu, I've ever had

Briciola is one of my fave spots in the city for its overall good/service/atmosphere combo. I like the community style table although it is a bit cramped. But they always have specials, staff are patient and friendly, and I have never felt rushed here. Their cheesecake is YUMMY- they creme brulee the top for a crunch and smoky/caramel flavor and serve it with vanilla ice cream. I highly suggest their sparkling red wine if you like something sweeter; it's one of my fave wines! Their octopus was cooked well and the pastas are always well-seasoned. A little expensive (especially for the size) but I still enjoy my time there

We had great experience in this restaurant.
Since we already had small bites in another place, ordered one main dish with side menu. Food was also nice, but not super impressive.

First time here based on a recommendation and glad we took the advice. The food and service were excellent. The linguine with clams was one of the best I have ever had. The crab cakes and lobster ravioli were also very good! Nice wine selection but bottles could benefit from some light chilling/temperature control. Overall very happy!

What a beautiful atmosphere!

The food was good and the wine was also tasty. It's a little expensive but worth it.

The service was amazing- so kind and professional.

Yeah I donâ€™t know if the other reviewers actually ate at this restaurant or if we just ordered the wrong things, but I would not come here again. There is one long table for the dining room, which we knew ahead of time, but they sit you right next to diners despite the table being mostly empty. The food we got was made by chef boyardee and thatâ€™s generous. All that said, the service was very good. The waitress was quick and everyone was polite. I wish I could give this a better rating because of how great the service was but the food and dining situation just were not it.

A BRILLIANT Italian restaurant in Hell's Kitchen, Bricola definitely has it all - delicious food, an impressive wine list, a cozy atmosphere, and excellent service.

A big shout-out to our server Sarah who was very attentive and super friendly. I'll definitely return.

An amazing place! We were lucky to get a table without a reservation in the dining area across the street from the main restaurant.

The tiramisu, shrimp pasta, and seafood pasta were all delicious, fresh, and excellent!

The service was friendly.
A great spot for dinner!

A very traditional and worthwhile selection of Italian dishes. The price is perfect. Meatball is impressive to me. The cheesecake is worth mentioning! The cheese they used was very unique, fresh, and suitable. I was very impressed. I believe that this cheesecake has no competition at the same or double price point.

Amazing gnocchi sorrentina. We are here before our show on broadway. Be sure to get a reservation because the space is small! We were sad they didnâ€™t have espresso martinis but enjoyed a yummy chocolate one instead.

The food and services was incredible! The place is impressively small so reservations are a must. We had a party of 8, so we were told to wait a few extra minutes outside in the cold but 100% worth it for the food and wine.

We spotted this place on a stroll through Hellâ€™s Kitchen and liked the menu and setting so we booked a table. Itâ€™s quite a small place with a shared high table inside, seats at the bar and a number of covered tables outside. We sat inside at the shared table. Thereâ€™s a nice calm and relaxing ambience inside. We originally intended to explore the Cichetti menu, but they had a great selection of specials including Octopus salad and Branzino which caught our attention. We ordered these along with crab and shrimp cake. Food was delicious, especially the Octopus salad. Service was friendly and attentive throughout. They have a nice selection of Italian wine to complement the food.  We really enjoyed our meal and evening and will definitely return on our next trip to NYC.

Amazing experience!!!! The freshest tapas/italian food, with the most cozy, chic and cool place + atmosphere ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°

Staff was so nice and prices very good too - would recommend to everybody

We ate at Bricola for a light and late dinner. We had the Tuna Tartare, Cheese and Meat Platter and the Tiramisu. All were excellent and the restaurant had a very charming and cozy atmosphere. We really appreciated being able to find somewhere still taking orders and serving just after 11pm - our connecting flight out of JFK was canceled and we were unexpectedly in New York for the evening. Recommend and would return.
Very small place with excellent service. We got 2 specials of the night, branzino and octopus salad and they were one of the best we've ever had. Didn't care for crab cakes, too oily.

I am forever grateful for this recommendation. What a gem!! I keep going back here for the food and such friendly staff! Feels like such a nice, cozy oasis/getaway in Hellâ€™s Kitchen. I am that person that will always order the same thing, but had to try their latest special! Veal chop with mashed potatoes and asparagus in a mushroom sauce. YUMMMMM! Run donâ€™t walk while itâ€™s on the menu. Also always order the following starters: eggplant goat cheese, lamp chop lollipops, warm octopus salad.. actually just order everything on the appetizers menu. You wonâ€™t regret it!!!

A fantastic little Italian restaurant on the corner of the street in Hellâ€™s Kitchen area. I originally found this restaurant on TikTok before traveling from the UK and pre-booked. We are at around 5pm and by 6 the outside seating was full with a lovely family friendly atmosphere. The menu was generous and greatly priced, with daily specials being offered for plenty of choice. The inside wine collection is also incredible.
